MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow CloneRow (Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow row);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow CloneRow(class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow row) cil managed

static member CloneRow : Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow -> Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow

Docs.summary: Returns a row that is a deep in-memory copy of an input row. Note that inactive columns are allowed in this row, and their activity or inactivity will be reflected in the output row. Note that the deep copy includes a copy of the metadata as well.
Docs.returns: A deep in-memory copy of the input row

static member GetGetterAsStringBuilder : Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow * int -> Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.ValueGetter<System.Text.StringBuilder>

Docs.summary: Given an IRow, and column index, return a function that utilizes the on the input rows to map the values in the column, whatever type they may be, into a string builder. This method will obviously succeed only if there is a string conversion into the required type. This method can be useful if you want to output a value as a string in a generic way, but don't really care how you do it.

Docs.summary: This method returns a small helper delegate that returns whether we are at the start of a new group, that is, we have just started, or the key-value at indicated column is different than it was, in the last call. This is practically useful for determining group boundaries. Note that the delegate will return true on the first row.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IDataView RowAsDataView (Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IHostEnvironment env, Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow row);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IDataView RowAsDataView(class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IHostEnvironment env, class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow row) cil managed
Public Shared Function RowAsDataView (env As IHostEnvironment, row As IRow) As IDataView
static member RowAsDataView : Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IHostEnvironment * Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IRow -> Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.IDataView

Docs.param: An environment used to create the host for the resulting data view
A row, whose columns must all be active
Docs.summary: Given a row, returns a one-row data view. This is useful for cases where you have a row, and you wish to use some facility normally only exposed to dataviews. (E.g., you have an but want to save it somewhere using a .) Note that it is not possible for this method to ensure that the input does not change, so users of this convenience must take care of what they do with the input row or the data source it came from, while the returned dataview is potentially being used; if this is somehow difficult it may be wise to use to first have a deep copy of the resulting row.
Docs.returns: A single-row data view incorporating that row
